item.title: Understanding Kochava attribution with Garrett MacDonald
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special interview we talk with Garrett MacDonald from Kochava about using attribution to know who your customers are and how they use your app. Kochava gives you a deeper understanding of your app’s performance and, more importantly, where your customers are coming from.
item.content:encoded:
In this special interview we talk with Garrett MacDonald from Kochava about using attribution to know who your customers are and how they use your app. Kochava gives you a deeper understanding of your app’s performance and, more importantly, where your customers are coming from. Implement attribution using Kochava in just a few lines of code using the Kochava plugin for Corona.

Promote Your Apps:

  • Add your app to the Corona Showcase
  • Submit your app to be a Case Study candidate

Thank you for watching and listening

item.title: Flurry dashboard walkthrough with Developer Evangelist, Tasmin Singh
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with UX Designer, Ali Eslamifar about the importance of having empathy for your users and how it drives us to also recognize that users don't always know what they want.
item.content:encoded:
In this special three part interview Flurry Developer Evangelist, Tasmin Singh walks us through some of the updates and reporting options found in the Flurry mobile analytics dashboard.

Tasmin then talked about understanding user behavior.

We then wrapped things up with a discussion on mobile app analytics tracking best practices.

Implement Flurry in your Corona apps using our Flurry plugin for Corona SDK.

item.title: Maximize app revenue with ironSource rewarded video and offerwalls
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with ironSource about the importance of reinvesting ad revenue back into app promotion to grow a user base and we discussed the merits of combing rewarded video and offerwalls to engage users and maximize earnings.
item.content:encoded:
In this special interview we talk with Garrett Olson about app monetization using ironSource. Garrett talked about the importance of reinvesting ad revenue back into app promotion to grow an app’s user base. We also discussed the merits of combing the use of rewarded video and offerwalls to engage users and maximize earnings from your apps.

To get started, sign up with ironSource, then use the easy ironSource plugin for Corona SDK.

item.title: Interview: Monetize using polls and surveys with Pollfish
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special interview we talked with Andreas Vourkos from Pollfish about app monetization using polls and surveys. Pollfish gives app users the ability to share their opinions while helping you support your app's development.
item.content:encoded:
In this special interview we talk with Andreas Vourkos from Pollfish about app monetization using polls and surveys.

Pollfish gives app users the ability to share their opinions while helping you support your app’s development. You can also implement your own in-house polls and surveys to collect feedback from your app users.

Andreas points out that in most cases, polls and surveys pay more than video ads. Everything happens within your app so you keep users inside your app and don’t have to disrupt your existing UI design to implement Pollfish.

item.title: Monetize using intelligent ad mediation by Appodeal
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special interview we talked with Gareth Lee from Appodeal about their intelligent ad mediation. Appodeal handles the showing of ads from the highest paying campaigns using sophisticated, programmatic algorithms.
item.content:encoded:
In this special interview we talked with Gareth Lee from Appodeal about their intelligent ad mediation. Appodeal handles the showing of ads from the highest paying campaigns using sophisticated, programmatic algorithms. Gareth explains how this translates into higher earnings for developers and a better experience for users. Implement Appodeal’s intelligent ad mediation solution into your apps with just a few lines of code using the Appodeal plugin for Corona.

item.title: Developing engaging word puzzle games with Steve Bullock
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special interview we talk with Steve Bullock to learn what it takes to create engaging word games like Word Roundup Stampede. Steve has developed word games for over 20 years and is now teamed up with David L. Hoyt, the world’s most syndicated daily game creator.
item.content:encoded:
In this special interview we talk with Steve Bullock from Adveractive about the inspiration, development, and release of Word Roundup Stampede.

Steve has been developing word games for over 20 years and he now develops games with nationally syndicated puzzle creator David L. Hoyt. As the world’s most syndicated daily game creator, David’s puzzle games and brain teasers appear in USA Today’s Up & Down Words, Jumble Crosswords, and TV Jumble.

Together, Steve and David have published Just 2 Words, Just Jumble, Word Winder, and Just 2 Fun, all using Corona.

In this interview, Steve shares some great insights into what it takes to create engaging puzzle games. Follow Word Roundup Stampeded on Facebook for news and release updates.

item.title: Adding consumer brands to a skater game with Dain Hedgpeth
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with Dain Hedgpeth about adding consumer brands to apps. Dain's Skater game focuses on the authenticate elements of skate culture while seamlessly integrating both shoe and board brands into the game play. Hear what he would do differently if he started over today.
item.content:encoded:
In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with Dain Hedgpeth about adding consumer brands to apps. Dain’s Skater game focuses on the authenticate elements of skate culture while  seamlessly integrating both shoe and board brands into the game play. We asked Dain to share the lessons he has learned along the way and also what he would do differently if he started over today. His answers might surprise you.

item.title: Developing Super Robot Jump Jump with Matt Rathbun
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with Matt Rathbun about his indie game developer journey and how he managed to develop Super Robot Jump Jump while sleeping on a friend's couch.
item.content:encoded:
In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with Matt Rathbun about his indie game developer journey and how he managed to develop Super Robot Jump Jump while sleeping on a friend’s couch. Matt shares what it’s like to hire and work with a remote designer who later becomes full-time employed outside of the game development project. Also hear what Matt says is the secret to success in game marketing.

item.title: Animating Street Puncher with Bobby Rasmusson
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with Bobby Rasmusson about developing and hand drawing hundreds of animations for his Street Puncher game. Bobby also shares what he would do differently to get featured in the app stores.
item.content:encoded:
In this special Corona Geek podcast we talked with Bobby Rasmusson about his experience developing and hand drawing hundreds of animations for his Street/ Puncher game. Bobby is a self taught animator and product manager for Lyft. During the interview, Bobby shared his experience with in-app purchases, incentivizing players to share the game, and the things he would do differently to get featured in the app stores.

item.title: Corona Geek #195 – Pebble Watch, math2D, Sudoku generator, PayPal plugins
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: On this week's Corona Geek podcast, we discussed several new plugins for Pebble Watch, faster math2D operations, Sudoku puzzle generation, and offering PayPal payment options for physical goods. Plus we got a sneak peek at a modular match 3 space RPG game.
item.content:encoded:
On this week’s Corona Geek podcast, we discussed several new plugins for Pebble Watch, faster math2D operations, Sudoku puzzle generation, and offering PayPal payment options for physical goods. We also got a sneak peek at a modular match 3 space RPG game that’s being developed for the Corona community by Michael Wilson at Ponywolf. Once the game is complete, the source code, asset pack, and custom sounds will be made available to the community.

Panelists:

  • Scott Harrison
  • Mike Hempfling
  • Steven Johnson
  • Sergey Lera
  • Ed Maurina
  • Charles McKeever
  • Michael Wilson

Time Saving Tools:

  • Automatically generate project configurations using Ed’s Awesome Tool (EAT) for Corona SDK.
  • Check out the widget theme work Mike Hempfling is doing at Crave Creative.

Promote Your Apps:

  • Add your app to the Corona Showcase
